alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 11:26AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following county, Ashland. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. The current stage on the Black Fork Mohican River is 9.87 feet, the river is expected to rise above 10 feet today with minor flooding expected along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Loudonville, Hayesville, Perrysville, Mifflin and Mohicanville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
